BLUE KEY FETED
Hopkiws' newest major organization, the Blue Key Club, received a strong kick-off at a
dinner meeting last week when
forty selected student leaders,
hosted by Admissions Directors
Robert Bilgrave and his assistant Mac Johnson, were presented with the plans for the
coming year.

Formed for the purpose of
conducting tours of the Hopkins
campus for prospective freshparents, and
men, visiting
VIP's—Blue Key is expected to
fill the need for a centralized
source, of campus tours.
This central source will eliminate the problem of communication which existed under

the old system according to
the temporary chairman of Blue
Key, Chips Lickson. In past
years, the tour responsibility
was shared among the Student
Council, the Veterans' Club,
APO and the Boosters' Club.
Many otther colleges have
groups with the specific responsibility of conducting tours.
Last year's organizers contacted
these groups—the Brown Key at
Brown, the Orange Key at
Princeton; and from the information obtained, extracted
those parts useful at Hopkins.
Blue Key will begin tours late
in October. It will offer prospective freshmen the opportunity

to see Hopkins students and be
given a good tour of the campus.
Lickson said he felt that this
would afford a better chance
for these visitors to feel at home
here and good tours could possibly sway in JHU's direction
some individuals who are torn
between two or more schools.
